Expression-Based Cell Lineage Analysis in Drosophila Through a Course-Based Research Experience for Early Undergraduates.

Welcome to the G-TRACE Expression Database!.

The G al4 T echnique for R eal-Time a nd C lonal E xpression (G-TRACE) system is a tool for Drosophila developmental biologists that provides both spatial and temporal information about the activity of the Gal4 reporter protein in developing tissues.

The G-TRACE Expression Database (GED) features analyses of the brain, eye and wing imaginal discs, and the lymph gland from wandering stage third-instar larvae.

At the point of analysis, the G-TRACE system utilizes secondary fluorescent protein reporters to identify cells that are either currently expressing Gal4 (DsRed-expressing cells) or are derived from cells that have previously expressed Gal4 (EGFP-expressing cells).
